about_the_game:
Travel across Austria in Train Simulator with the St. Pölten – Linz railway from RSSLO.

The St. Pölten to Linz railway is a crucial segment of Austria's railway network, providing an essential connection between two significant cities in the country. The route connects St. Pölten, the capital of Lower Austria, with Linz, the capital of Upper Austria. Covering 190 km this electrified double track is one of the major arteries of the Austrian network carrying passenger and freight services daily.

Recreated in authentic detail by RSSLO for Train Simulator the route features 26 stations, picturesque landscapes and significant landmarks. Travel from St. Pölten with its Baroque cathedral, through the vineyards of the Wachau valley (a UNESCO World Heritage site), past historic villages, and along the Danube river as you head into Linz.

You can take in these views from the cab of the ÖBB 1116 ‘Taurus’. This is included with the route along with a selection of appropriate rolling stock. ÖBB Bmpz carriages for passenger duties and a variety of freight wagons including Snps, Shimmns and Habbins. The loco and rolling stock are used across the five included Career Scenarios.

Get ready to explore Austria with Train Simulator.

Included Scenarios

A selection of engaging Career and Quick Drive scenarios are included:

  • Winter paradise

  • Morning rush

  • RJ 544

  • Freight delivery

  • Avoid the city

  • (Quick Drive) St. Polten RJ

  • (Quick Drive) Linz RJ

  • (Quick Drive) Amstetten

  • (Quick Drive) St. Polten RJX

  • (Quick Drive) St Valentin

  • (Quick Drive) Pochlarn

  • (Quick Drive) Linz RJX

    More scenarios are available on the Steam Workshop online and in-game. Train Simulator’s Steam Workshop scenarios are free and easy to download, adding many more hours of exciting gameplay. With scenarios being added daily, why don’t you check it out now!

    Key Features

  • 190-km recreation of St. Pölten – Linz

  • 26 detailed stations Authentic landscapes and scenery

  • Realistic signalling and track signage

  • ÖBB 1116 electric locomotive Rolling stock included:

  • ÖBB Bmpz-i, ÖBB Bmz, Snps, Shimmns, Habbins, Eanos

  • AI locomotives to spot include: ÖBB 1293, ÖBB 4024, ÖBB 1063

  • 5 Career scenarios Quick Drive compatible

  • Download size: 2.4 GB

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum for 32-bit:
  • OS *: 32-bit Windows 7 Service Pack 1, 8.1 or 10 Required (Other OS versions and types are not supported)
  • Processor: Intel Core-i3 4330 3.50 GHz Dual Core or AMD A8 6600K 3.90 GHz Quad Core or Better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 750 Ti or AMD Radeon R9 Graphics with 1 GB Dedicated VRAM or Better
  • DirectX®: 9.0c
  • Network: Broadband Connection (May incur additional costs for use)
  • Storage: 40 GB or more available space (Additional Add-Ons will require more)
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Audio Device
  • Additional Notes: Requires mouse and keyboard or Xbox Controller
Laptop, Notebook, Mobile or Low Power versions of the above specifications (including Intel or Integrated Graphics) may work but are not supported. Updates to Chipset, Graphics and Audio Device Drivers may be required. For information relating to recommended specifications for Train Simulator 64-bit, please refer to the Train Simulator Classic User Guide.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended for 32-bit:
  • OS *: 32- or 64-bit Windows 7 Service Pack 1, 8.1 or 10 Required (Other OS versions and types are not supported)
  • Processor: Intel Core-i5 4690 3.50 GHz Quad Core or AMD Ryzen 7 1700 3.80 GHz Quad Core or Better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM (maximum possible under 32-bit Windows)/16 GB or Better (For 64-bit Windows)
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 or AMD Radeon RX 480 with 4 GB Dedicated VRAM or Better
  • DirectX®: 9.0c
  • Network: Broadband Connection (May incur additional costs for use)
  • Storage: High Performance SSD Recommended with 40 GB or more available space (Additional Add-Ons will require more)
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Audio Device
  • Additional Notes: Requires mouse and keyboard or Xbox Controller
Laptop, Notebook, Mobile or Low Power versions of the above specifications (including Intel or Integrated Graphics) may work but are not supported. Updates to Chipset, Graphics and Audio Device Drivers may be required. For information relating to recommended specifications for Train Simulator 64-bit, please refer to the Train Simulator Classic User Guide.
